item.title: Origin stories: Poisson-Lindley distribution
item.description: You may find this post interesting if you’ve ever been reading a paper and noticed the author nonchalantly introducing some concept that just makes you go “where did THAT come from?” and felt the urge to recursively navigate references until you got an explanation for how such a thing came to be. Some context During the lit review for my master’s thesis, I was looking for some prior work on truncated distributions and found a paper by Ghitany, Al-Mutairi, and Nadarajah (2008).
